Fields.DialogueText: Stupid piece of trash! Why can't you just do something right for once?
Hey, that's no way to talk about a part of your own body. So to speak.
What? No, I'm talking about my gear. It's been more disappointing than usual.

Fields.MenuText: Really? It looks good to me.
It's usually disappointing?
What's wrong with it?

Fields.DialogueText: Then maybe you should wear it. It feels so awkward on me. It barely even fits.
Hai. Though maybe my aspirations for it are a little high...
I don't know where to start. It's so cumbersome, and it feels like it's falling apart at the seams.
I know it's probably my fault in the first place. I shouldn't have been tinkering with it so much.
Well, if it's really causing you so much trouble, we can always look into getting some new equipment.
Oh, trust me, I've been thinking about it.
*ALARM*
However, it's hard to think about anything when that racket's constantly breaking my concentration.
Don't blame the ship, blame the Morganas.
@BATTLE
Aoba, what are you doing?! Put that gun down!
Nani o itte iru no? What's your problem? It's broken. Can't I take it apart?
Oh...you were holding it like...the barrel was pointed at your head...
You thought I was...? I wouldn't shoot myself. I know better.

Fields.MenuText: Wars can weigh on people, Aoba. Sometimes, too much.
Broken or not, it's still dangerous.
My apologies. I should've known you were smarter than that.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmph! I'm perfectly happy.
Not once I start dismantling it. I know how guns work, and I know how to make sure they don't work.
Daijoubu desu. I suppose it's good to know you care.
So why exactly are you taking a broken gun apart?
I like to take things apart and put them back together. Machinery is nice that way. You can break them down to individual pieces and build them back up again, and they only work better.
That's an interesting outlook to have, Aoba.
Now if you'd give me a little time alone, I'd like to try and get this thing working again before we run into any Morganas.
You can get that working again? Now that I see it up close, some of the parts are so mangled they're almost unrecognizable.
I've seen worse.
@BATTLE
Hmmmm...
What's with that smile?
Oh, Kanchou! I didn't notice you there. Don't mind me, I'm daydreaming.
About?
Sometimes when I'm working, I like to daydream about the day my inventions are noticed and they're so universally loved by the Japanese populace that everyone...
Am I getting carried away?
Sorry, I just... I have aspirations. This war will end one day, and I plan on making sure that Japan is on top by then.
You keep me grounded, Kanchou. You could be nicer about it - but I can't spend my entire life with my head in the clouds.
Well...I sometimes dream of being a household name. I want to invent something...truly necessary. Something that will help give Japan an edge over the rest of the world.
*ALARM*
I almost forgot, there's a war we're fighting back here in reality.
True, but dreams are nice to have, Aoba. Just don't get absorbed in them.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Maybe just a little.
Yeah. Honestly, I don't think that's ever going to happen.
No. Go on.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmmm...
Are you reading a comic book, Aoba?
It's Flash Gordon. Do you have a problem with that?

Fields.MenuText: I didn't know you were an egghead.
Are you kidding? Flash Gordon's great.
It's a surprise, you know, seeing you reading a western comic.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, you're clearly not paying attention. Call me what you will, I'll wear the names with pride.
You've got that right. Buck Rogers is okay, but Flash is the best.
There's nothing wrong with Western culture. Japan's culture is superior, of course, but there are some ideas I wouldn't mind adopting.
You shouldn't get me started, Kanchou. I could talk about science fiction for days if you let me.
What would be so bad about that?
Then I wouldn't get any work done.
*ALARM*
Clearly we couldn't have that, now could we?
@BATTLE
So what are you tinkering with this time? Are you making a ray gun or something?
Pft. Don't think I'm not working on the plans - but, no. I'm trying to squeeze out as much as I can from this gun.
Why don't you make a gun so powerful it's capable of shooting a bullet through time?
... That's not a terrible idea for a movie. Although, I get the sense that you're teasing me, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not teasing you! I honestly think it's a good idea.
Maybe a little.
So you're saying you couldn't do it?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't disagree, but you can't forget that we still live in reality, Kanchou.
Well, you can stop. I know this isn't some science fiction world, sir.
I wish I could, but unfortunately, we're still living in reality.
You have to admit, our reality has been leaning more toward science fiction lately.
What do you mean?
*ALARM*
Morganas, to start with.
...You have a point.
Not to mention, you're the spirit of a warship.
Hmmm, I never thought about it that way.
@BATTLE
That's a whole lot of paper, Aoba. What are you working on?
These are the designs for my new gear. I know it might be a little advanced, but what do you think?
I think it looks like something out of a comic. You think you can actually create something like this?
I'd like to believe so. What do you think is so crazy about it?

Fields.MenuText: Well, first of all, the armor would be catastophically heavy.
Part of this gear involves some sort of cloaking technology. I'm not sure such a thing is possible.
If anyone could do this... I'd put my money on you.

Fields.DialogueText: That's only if we used conventional material.
Hai. I'll give you that. That's a pipe dream. But a girl can hope.
I'll try my best so you don't end up broke.
Even if your ideas are a little fantastic, I'd like to hear more about them.
*ALARM*
That alarm never ceases to annoy me.
You get used to it.
Hmmm... I'd rather not...
@BATTLE
*CATCHY MUSIC*
Aoba, what is that?
Hmmm? Oh, I do believe that's the alarm. I'm pretty sure it means we have Morganas headed this direction.
But it's music! Why? Where's the blaring alarm everyone knows?
I... upgraded it.
*BOOM*
We'll talk about this later. Right now, we have more pressing matters to deal with.
@BATTLE
Wasn't too bad of a battle.
It would've been easier if everyone had been prepared. No one knew what was going on because of your little upgrade.
Oh, come on, you can't honestly miss that annoying, blaring sound.

Fields.MenuText: Actually, I can't stand it - but it's the standard across the fleet for a reason.
I kind of liked it, you know.
Look, I wish we could keep this new tune - it's kind of catchy. But it's too dangerous.

Fields.DialogueText: How about I tweak it a little to combine the two?
You liked it? What are you, deaf?
The crew will figure out what it means soon enough. We'll fill ‘em in.
Aoba, fix it. Now.
Ugh, fine. I'll take care of it.
Right back to how it was.
I know. Good grief, no room for progress on this ship.
Maybe we'll talk about a new alarm at a later time.
... Really? Or are you just stringing me along?
Really. Now go, you have work to do.
You have some time, Kanchou? I wanted to talk about those ideas I have.
You mean the ones that we're a good century away from being able to implement?
Don't be such a pessimist!
I'll try to restrain the urge. Sit down and tell me how you're going to make those dreams come true.
You said something that sparked this idea, Kanchou. Our reality is becoming more and more like some sci-fi universe.
Sigh-five?
Sci-fi. It's short for science fiction. It's a good term; I think it'll spread...
Anyway, you said what you did and I realized that the missing component in my designs could be right in front of us. We can utilize the Morganas.
You want to... make new gear out of Morgana parts?
Sounds a little gruesome, I know, but theoretically, it could work. What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: Dangerous is what it sounds like. That's a lot of risk for a theory.
We're fighting the Morganas anyway. It couldn't hurt to try and salvage some parts.
...Wouldn't sci-fic make more sense? It's fiction, not fi-tion...

Fields.DialogueText: Are my theories ever wrong? It's a safe bet. It's a bet on me.
We'd need very specific parts from very specific Morganas. Don't worry, I've already got some leads.
It's sci-fi, it sounds better. Don't think about it too hard, Kanchou.
Are we doing this or not?
... I'll allow you to look into it.
*ALARM*
What do you know? Maybe that's your future gear now.
I doubt it will be quite that easy.
@BATTLE
But we're going to be careful about it. Half of what they're using is probably salvaged from human ships - but for all we know they can control the other half remotely.
Hai. It's very possible. Wouldn't it be amazing if we could use it against them?
Hey, Aoba, I was looking for you, I wanted to go over some of the... what's that box holding?
This is the Funadama-sama. You can thank it for all our recent good luck.
Kanchou, this box brings with it the fortune of Funadama, Goddess of Mariners.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, Funadama, of course. I thought you said Funny Dooma. My mistake.
I've never heard of her. You sure you didn't get ripped off or something?
What's in the box?

Fields.DialogueText: What's a Funny Dooma?
I didn't get ripped off. How you've never heard of the Goddess of Mariners is beyond me.
It varies from box to box. In this one, I put a pair of dice and some coins to win the favor of Funadama.
It's surprising to see you put so much stock into a goddess.
What do you mean? Do I seem disrespectful to you?
I mean that you can't take apart religion and put it back together. It's all about faith.
Don't misunderstand me. I'm not relying on this thing or Funadama to get us through this war. But just in case she casts her gaze in our direction, I'd rather it be favorably.
So it's like a backup, of sorts?
Hai. You could say that.
*ALARM*
I'm not sure it's working.
Say that after the battle.
@BATTLE
I don't know. That's why I was so confused.

Fields.MenuText: It's some sort of good luck charm?
Ah. Of course.

Fields.DialogueText: So those are supposed to be our first Morganas to hunt?
That's the report I've gotten. They sound perfect for what I'm planning.
This says they're quick and capable of shooting faster than most Morganas we've faced.
Exactly.

Fields.MenuText: Sounds like worthy opponents.
Why exactly do we need to take down those Morganas?
I hope you know that if we die, I'm blaming you.

Fields.DialogueText: Hey, don't start getting cocky. This is extremely dangerous. But if we can defeat them, then we'll be extremely dangerous.
It's speed. I want to try and capture their speed for myself.
We're not going to die. But just in case, I'm going to stuff this Funadama-sama full.
Aoba, you have a plan for this thing, right? We're not just going to charge in and hope for the best, right?
I have a battle plan, but it does start that way.
*ALARM*
You don't think those are the fast ones, do you?
Oh, come on, calm down. We're nowhere near where they were last spotted.
You said they were fast!
Not that fast. They're not capable of lightspeed travel.
@BATTLE
Morgana patrol sighted!
@BATTLE
We did it! We... I can't... that was amazing! Did you see those Morganas? I thought we were goners for sure.

Fields.MenuText: They weren't that scary. We had everything under control.
You're not the only one. I was sure we had bitten off more than we could chew.
There were some rough moments, but once again, we came out on top.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. This is only the first victory of many.
But... but we won. We can do this. We're only going to get stronger now.
And we'll continue to come out on top. This is one step of many that we'll take to our ultimate goal.
Quick, we have to hurry and gather as many resources as we can from the battlefield.
What exactly are we looking for?
Something... powerful. I'll know it when I see it. Better yet, Japan will know who to thank when they see it.
That's not going to help us find whatever you're looking for right now, in the present.
Stop complaining. We need to hurry and scavenge!
So what do you think? They're excellent, aren't they?
Those gauntlets? They look kind of... ramshackle. I hope you didn't pay too much for them.
Hey, I didn't pay anything for them! I made these. Though I you might have a point about the aesthetics. I can work on that. These are just prototypes after all.
So that's what you made from the remains of those Morganas?
Don't look so disappointed. You haven't even see what they can do yet.
What can they do?
Prepare to be impressed.
*BOOM*
Whoa!
Holy—are you okay, Aoba?
I'm fine, I'm fine. What do you think? Pretty impressive, right?
You made arm-mounted guns?

Fields.MenuText: That doesn't seem a little dangerous to you?
That's amazing. How did you manage to make something like that?
I'm concerned about you. The force of that single shot knocked you on your butt.

Fields.DialogueText: All weapons are dangerous. This is a warship. These are just dangerous and clever.
It was not easy. I had to mess with my designs a little to incorporate the modified materials from the Morgana, but I'm happy with the final product.
Okay, so it's not perfect. These are the first of many prototypes. Eventually, I hope to redirect all the force forward. I just need to work on my calculations.
I know they're not perfect, but it's progress. We need to go after the next Morganas.
Already? You're sure? You don't want to take some time to rest and recover?
Not even a lit—ow!
What's wrong?
Another problem with the gauntlets. I didn't think about heat distribution. I've got to run and tear these things off!
I'll let you know if we run into any trouble on the way to our next target!
Arigatō!
@BATTLE
You're sure those Morganas are supposed to be somewhere around here, Aoba?
You saw the same report I did. Every sighting and every projected course converge here...
Well, I don't see anything.
Think about it. We're after it because people talk about them like they're ninjas.
Ninjas? Really?
Hai. Hidden. Never sensed until it's too late. Often the last thing their victims see.

Fields.MenuText: And yet again, you thrust us into a conflict with powerful Morganas.
Sounds more like sharks. Or, like pumas stalking preys.
Sounds fun. If we defeat the ninjas, what does that make us?

Fields.DialogueText: Subpar materials make for subpar products. How many times do I have to explain this?
Semantics. Either way, those Morganas are going to be a challenge to detect before it's too late. And ninjas are more impressive.
That would make us members of a very exclusive club, Kanchou.
*BOOM*
What was that?!
I think we found our targets!
Sound the alarm! We've got company!
@BATTLE
Hey, Kanchou! Here to check on my progress with our latest Morgana spoils?
Actually, I was here to ask to borrow something.
Borrow what? The gauntlets aren't ready for another test run, if that's what you're thinking.
As tempting as that sounds, I wanted to borrow some Flash Gordon comics, actually.
Really? Why is that?

Fields.MenuText: I'm a huge fan and it's been way too long since I've been able to read any.
I have some rare free time, and I figured it might be a good chance to try some "sci-fi."
Eh, maybe this was a bad idea. Never mind.

Fields.DialogueText: Sō desu ne? Well, of course, I'd be more than happy to share with a fellow space head.
Hmmm, okay, I can share. But only because you used my term.
No, no, no, you're not going anywhere without enough Flash Gordon to turn you into a diehard fan.
Why is it all covered in plastic?
To protect it. It's a collection of years' worth of newspaper strips - I don't know how I'd replace them if anything were to happen.
I swear.
Arigatō. Now go and read, I've got some tinkering to do.
@BATTLE
You're only to remove the comics from their plastic covers when you're reading them. Promise me you'll be careful.
Kanchou! Kanchou! Watch this, check it out!
Your jacket just changed colors.
Hai! Isn't that great? Those Funayūrei had a kind of goo that changes color when you run an electrical current through it, and we captured enough to play with!

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, but it's not exactly perfect camouflage. I can still see you.
That's pretty impressive - but I hope you're aiming higher than just making a fashion statement.
Can you make me one? I think I'd look good in polka dots.

Fields.DialogueText: For now. I'm working on it. I'm hoping I'll be able to completely blend in with my surroundings soon.
Of course not. Though, that's an interesting idea... I could maybe be able to repurpose some of the...
It doesn't work that way. If you want a polka dot shirt, go find a tailor.
*ALARM*
You better take that jacket off. I wouldn't want any of the crew to run into you because they didn't see you.
Maybe one day that will be a real concern.
@BATTLE
Aoba, you're drifting off subject.
Hai. Sorry about that.
We're nearing our target area. The last thing we need is for those particular Morganas to get the drop on us, so keep a wary eye out.
You can say that again. We've lost too many destroyers to them already.
Hai. It's nice to hear that you read the dossier I put together for you.

Fields.MenuText: I've read all the reports you've given me. I don't walk into these hunts blind.
Eh, I skimmed it. It seemed dense.
Huh? What are you talking about? I heard you mention it before.

Fields.DialogueText: I underestimated you a little, Kanchou. I apologize.
...I'm not surprised, and I don't blame you. I prefer a good story over a report any day of the week.
Hmmm. At least you listen to me talk. I suppose that's better than only paying attention to a report.
Aoba, remind me, what exactly do those Morganas look like again?
I already went over that. You'll know them by the plumes of smoke rising from their ship. From weapons testing, apparently.
So like that, right?
What? Let me - is that? It is! They haven't seen us yet. This is our chance! Let's make sure we don't get destroyed in a single shot, okay?
We will be careful.
@BATTLE
All right, that last hunt was a little too close for comfort...

Fields.MenuText: Thank you, Funadama, for all of our good fortune. I humbly request that you continue to keep us afloat.
I don't really know how to do this... keep up the good work, girl?
This doesn't feel right. Maybe I need a better box...

Fields.DialogueText: Well, what do you know? Looks like somebody feels we need a little help from Funadama.
That's it? You're praying to a goddess, you need to put a little more effort into it.
I'll say. It looks like that thing is made out of cardboard.
Aoba! What did I say about coming through my walls?
Sorry, I was excited. I wanted to show you the second prototype of my gauntlets. I had no idea I'd walk in on... this.
That's fair. I'm not entirely sure what I'm supposed to be doing with it.
That's obvious. Let's see here. What did you put in here? It's so heavy.
Donations from the crew. Some of the sailors said money is usually offered at these shrines, so apparently-
You filled this thing with coins? That's not how it works, Kanchou.
*ALARM*
We can go over the basics later. For now, I'd return those coins to the crew. Or at least do something else with them.
Let's focus on the Morganas, shall we?
@BATTLE
(The Captain glances down at a box of Funadama paraphernalia.)

Fields.MenuText: I hope this is how this whole "Funadama-sama" thing works.
Maybe a show of respect wouldn't be completely inappropriate.
I really need to get this stuff out of my quarters.

Fields.DialogueText: What stuff is that?
Aoba, I need more.
More? More what?
I need to borrow some more Flash Gordon comics. I...may have gotten hooked.
Are you serious?

Fields.MenuText: Oh, stop smiling like that, it's not like I'm in love with him, like you.
Yes, and it's embarrassing, but I can't stop reading at a cliffhanger.
I can't deny it, it's a good read. And it definitely went by too fast. I might want to borrow more this time.

Fields.DialogueText: Hey, I'm not in love with him!
I understand that. It's a hook that keeps you ensnared and wanting more.
I'll loan you as much as you want. You just can't have them all, I need something to read too.
*ALARM*
Oh, come on, things were just getting good! I don't get to talk about my eggheaded pursuits enough.
We can talk about sci-fi after the battle, Aoba. Let's go.
Heh, admit it, sci-fi is a great term, isn't it?
@BATTLE
You're blushing.
Shut up!
Hey, Aoba, do you have a minute?
No, go away. Ima wa jikan ga arimasen.
That is not a way to talk to your captain, Aoba.
Sorry, I'm in the middle of something here. If I don't keep my hands steady, we could all go up.

Fields.MenuText: Seriously?
If it's that dangerous, maybe you shouldn't be doing it.
Fun. Need a hand?

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe. You want to risk it?
I might be exaggerating, but it's still dangerous.
No, I need space. Shoo, go away.
All right, I'll just wait over here.
Hmmm, I guess these are her designs. I can see all the different pieces of her gear.
Oh, this looks interesting.
Wait... this looks kind of like... is this some kind of weapon?
Hey, you needed something?
*ALARM*
Shoot. I guess we'll have to talk later.
We most certainly will.
@BATTLE
Hey, Aoba, we need to talk about this design.
Oh! Where'd you get that?

Fields.MenuText: From your workshop.
That's not important. What's important is you explaining this.
You... dropped it. Yeah. That's it.

Fields.DialogueText: Snooping around, huh? I didn't exactly hide it.
You were snooping, weren't you? I had no idea you were so nosy.
Uh huh, that's a believable explanation.
Can you explain why it looks like you're designing Morgana-based weaponry without running it by your commanding officer, Aoba?
It's just... okay, you have to keep it between the two of us.
All right. Talk.
Eventually, the Morganas will be defeated. When that happens, we'll likely still be at war. I don't anticipate the nations resolving their differences any time soon.
If we don't take advantage of this time we have now, I'm worried Japan won't come out on top.
So this weapon isn't for the Neutrality Fleet?
It can be, but it's primarily to aid my home. That's not the worst thing in the world, is it?
*ALARM*
Aoba, I don't want to see you working on this until we've had more time to talk it through.
All right, all right. I understand.
Now let's go take care of these Morganas.
(You won't see me working on it anymore...)
Did you say something?
Let's go!
@BATTLE
They're just ideas at this point, Kanchou. I'm not using Fleet resources or anything - just brainstorming.
But why the secrecy?
We don't need the non-Japanese crew thinking you're withholding resources that would help us win the war we're currently in.
They're not naive, Kanchou. I mean, do you really think every major power in the world isn't doing the same thing?
Oh, they probably are - but that's not our problem. *Our* problem is an invading fleet of monster ships.
All right, where are those Morganas? They can't be hard to find.
Those ones' strength is defense, not stealth.
Right. Reports of some kind of reinforced armor plating. Do we have enough power to pierce them?
Oh, I've been working on something.

Fields.MenuText: Nothing too dangerous, I hope.
Sounds interesting. I'm looking forward to seeing what you've got in store.
Didn't we talk about not doing dangerous experimental tinkering and stuff?

Fields.DialogueText: Not for us, anyway.
You won't have to wait too long. I'm raring to go over here.
Don't worry, this was a different project.
*ALARM*
Morganas inbound!
They're big ...
Good thing you've got me here. Let's tenderize those monsters.
What the hell is that? A rocket launcher?
Something like that. Plug your ears.
*BOOM*
This is going to be fun!
@BATTLE
All right, now this is more like it. This is what I would call a Funadama-sama.
It definitely looks official.
Do you want me to leave you alone to spend some time with it?

Fields.MenuText: It's something for the crew to rally around. It's not for me.
I don't know. I'd have to think about what I want to say.
You can stay - we can ask for Funadama's aid together.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, come on. Do you want Funadama to forsake us and let us sink to the bottom of the ocean?
Don't worry about it too much. It's the thought that counts.
Hmmm, okay, as long as I'm not too much of a distraction.
*ALARM*
I guess Funadama doesn't like the new box.
Or she really likes it, and is rewarding us with an easy victory.
Well, let's find out.
@BATTLE
Hey, Kanchou, here to check up on me?
Yeah, I was curious to see how your space suit was doing.
Space suit? What are you talking about?
All this gear you're building from the Morganas, it's starting to look like something straight out of science fiction.
I never thought about it that way... but, yes, I can see it.

Fields.MenuText: You really never thought about that? Seems like the first thing you would see.
Especially with this new helmet thing you're making. In fact, it looks a little unwieldy.
Really? I was joking.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I was looking at it more as a series of jobs, not one put-together thing.
It's a prototype. It'll work out in the end.
Seriously? Well, look at it. If I made it airtight, I might be able to take it up into space.
*ALARM*
I don't suppose that suit is ready for some action, is it?
Not quite. We'll have to deal with these Morganas the old fashioned way.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Everybody's panicking!
Well, look at those things. Those Morganas are horrifying. You can't blame them.

Fields.MenuText: I can, too. They're going to get us all killed.
Well, what are we supposed to do? The Morganas are getting too close for comfort.
I've seen worse. Clearly the rumors about this thing were all trumped up.

Fields.DialogueText: Not if I have anything to say about it.
There are still some officers who aren't running in fear. We can still fight.
You've seen worse? You're going to have to share some of those war stories with me later.
We need to move in. I'll try and calm the crew down, you focus on the fight.
This is going to be harder than usual.
What else is new?
@BATTLE
Things are starting to calm down.
We made it out of there alive. I think I need a vacation.
I think we all need a vacation.
But for now, let's just get to port. We took a few too many hits there.
What do you think? I look good, right?
You don't look half bad. That's the suit, huh? Does this mean you're all finished?
I'm not even close. It's more a proof of concept than anything I could comfortably wear every day. But it works!
I mean, look! The concussive gauntlets are nearly finished and direct all their force forward, and I'm coating some of the reinforced armor with the camouflage film.
What are you using from that last one we fought?
I have plans, but haven't had time to implement them. Rest assured, any Morganas we face will find us terrifying.
You're sure that'll work?
We'll find out. If it doesn't, I'll make adjustments. We've got a ways to go, but I'm excited!

Fields.MenuText: Me too. I'm sure the final product will be amazing.
I'm going to wait and see what comes of it before I get too excited.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't prop it up too much. I wouldn't want you to be disappointed.
Oh, you're going to be like that? Fine, one more person I'll prove myself to.
